p: The seedlings grew taller with increase in temperature and decrease in nutrient availability (Table 2, Fig. 2A). Despite their rather quick development and increase in stem height, a marked decrease in biomass was recorded for seedlings grown at the highest temperature of 34 °C (Table 2, Fig. 2B). With decrease in nutrients and decrease in temperature, the seedlings allocated more biomass to roots (Table 2, Fig. 2C).
